headline.main: Disclosures Are Found to Change Financial Behavior

docs.snippet: Even when financial institutions spell out terms for consumers, the objective can be obscured by the wording, a study finds....

headline.print_headline: Consumer Inquiry Focuses On Bank Overdraft Fees
headline.seo: Bank Overdraft Fees to Be Scrutinized by Consumer Bureau
headline.main: Consumer Inquiry Focuses on Bank Overdraft Fees

docs.snippet: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau said it would look into whether banks misled customers about the fees....
docs.abstract: Consumer Financial Protection Bureau begins an inquiry into how banks levy overdraft fees they charge customers who bounce checks or withdraw more than they have in their account using debit cards or automated teller machines; inquiry will focus on whether banks misled customers in 2010 when new regulations for overdraft protections were put in place.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau said it would look into whether banks misled customers about the fees.

headline.main: Yanks Abroad: For Pelosi, Progress at Liverpool Takes a Knock in the Knee

docs.snippet: After signing with England's Liverpool last fall and enjoying strong performances within the club's youth levels, Marc Pelosi is on the road to recovery after recently sustaining a knee injury....
docs.abstract: After signing with England's Liverpool last fall and enjoying strong performances within the club's youth levels, Marc Pelosi is on the road to recovery after recently sustaining a knee injury.

docs.snippet: The increase in brain activity that occurs with exercise appears to have implications not only for how well the brain functions during exercise, but also for how well our thinking and memory work the rest of the time....
docs.abstract: The increase in brain activity that occurs with exercise appears to have implications not only for how well the brain functions during exercise, but also for how well our thinking and memory work the rest of the time.

headline.print_headline: Obama Offers to Cut Corporate Tax Rate to 28%
headline.seo: Obama Offers to Cut Corporate Tax Rate to 28%
headline.main: Obama Offers to Cut Corporate Tax Rate to 28%

docs.snippet: President Obama plans to propose a reduction in business taxes in return for eliminating dozens of loopholes and subsidies....
docs.abstract: President Obama plans to propose changes to the corporate tax code to reduce the top rate to 28 percent, down from 35 percent; plan would also establish a minimum tax on multinational corporations' foreign earnings, to discourage shifting profits abroad; overhaul of the tax code in the coming year is unlikely, given the political backdrop and likelihood of businesses objecting to the closing of loopholes and loss of subsidies.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Obama plans to propose a reduction in business taxes in return for eliminating dozens of loopholes and subsidies.

headline.print_headline: Legal Fees Mount at Fannie and Freddie
headline.seo: Legal Fees for Fannie and Freddie Near $50 Million
headline.main: Legal Fees Mount at Fannie and Freddie

docs.snippet: As expenses rise, there are new calls to limit the costs at Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac and outlays for defending its former executives....

keywords.value: Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp (Freddie Mac)
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Analysis by the inspector general of the Federal Housing Finance Agency prompts new calls to limit the costs at Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac and outlays for defending its former executives; taxpayers have advanced almost $50 million in legal payments in the three years since the government rescued the giant mortgage companies; agency, acting as conservator, is charged with protecting taxpayers from further losses at Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, which now stand at $183 billion.
docs.lead_paragraph: As expenses rise, there are new calls to limit the costs at Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac and outlays for defending its former executives.

headline.main: New Enzyme Could Cut Cost of Ethanol Made From Waste

docs.snippet: Novozymes, a maker of industrial enzymes, says it has developed a product that is more efficient at converting corn husks, household waste and other raw material into ethanol, potentially making the process more competitive with ethanol made from ...
docs.abstract: Novozymes, a maker of industrial enzymes, says it has developed a product that is more efficient at converting corn husks, household waste and other raw material into ethanol, potentially making the process more competitive with ethanol made from corn.
